intro: Litosanthes cinerea, commonly known as the pale sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Litosanthes cinerea is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, water-storing leaves.
